docs.lead_paragraph: From the White House to the Vatican to the business elite in Davos, Switzerland, one issue keeps seizing the agenda: the growing gap between the very wealthy and everyone else.

headline.main: Wealth Gap: A Guide to What It Is, Why It Matters
headline.print_headline: Wealth Gap: A Guide to What It Is, Why It Matters

docs.snippet: From the White House to the Vatican to the business elite in Davos, Switzerland, one issue keeps seizing the agenda: the growing gap between the very wealthy and everyone else.

headline.main: The Business of Paid Family Leave

docs.abstract: Extending the disability-insurance model to help defray the costs of care for children, elderly and sick family members could help employees, with minimal impact on business, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Extending the disability-insurance model to help defray the costs of care for children, elderly and sick family members could help employees, with minimal impact on business, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rayfield Wright, who sustained countless blows to the head during 13 seasons with the Cowboys, said N.F.L. players do not know what awaits in retirement.

headline.main: For a Cowboys Star With Dementia, Time Is Running Out

docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column profiles NFL Hall of Famer Rayfield Wright, who at age 68, and with worsening dementia, is one of more than 4,500 players suing the NFL for concealing dangers of head injuries; notes that Wright feels current players are dangerously unaware of what awaits them in retirement.
docs.snippet: Rayfield Wright, who sustained countless blows to the head during 13 seasons with the Cowboys, said N.F.L. players do not know what awaits in retirement.

byline.contributor: Ken Belson and Alan Schwarz contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uber, the hot start-up whose software allows anyone with a smartphone to get a cab ride, is suddenly facing trouble.

headline.main: Rough Patch for Uber Service’s Challenge to Taxis
headline.print_headline: Rough Patch for Uber Service’s Challenge to Taxis

docs.abstract: Uber, which allows anyone with smartphone to find cab rides, is suddenly facing trouble; start-up is being sued by its drivers, who say it is stealing their tips; competitors are closing in, and many customers, including celebrity riders, are complaining about pricing and quality of drivers.
docs.snippet: Uber, the hot start-up whose software allows anyone with a smartphone to get a cab ride, is suddenly facing trouble.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president’s State of the Union address could underscore his inability so far to achieve the taxpayer-financed investments that he believes can lift the middle class and the poor.

headline.main: For Obama, Investing in Brighter Futures Remains a Tough Sell
headline.print_headline: For Obama, Investing in Brighter Futures Remains a Tough Sell

docs.abstract: Political Memo; Pres Obama's State of the Union address could underscore his inability so far to achieve the taxpayer-financed investments that he strongly believes could lift long-term economic prospects for country's middle class and poor.
docs.snippet: The president’s State of the Union address could underscore his inability so far to achieve the taxpayer-financed investments that he believes can lift the middle class and the poor.

headline.main: Who Should Be Invited to the State of the Union?

docs.abstract: To highlight certain priorities, the president invites a few guests each year to sit in the viewing gallery. Experts and readers can suggest who should be invited and why.
docs.snippet: To highlight certain priorities, the president invites a few guests each year to sit in the viewing gallery. Experts and readers can suggest who should be invited and why.

docs.lead_paragraph: Families shopping for health insurance through the new federal marketplace are running into trouble getting everyone covered when children are eligible for Medicaid but their parents are not.

docs.lead_paragraph: A bumper year for Britain's car industry offers some hope the economy will start to grow in a more sustainable way, with a better balance between investment and spending.

headline.print_headline: Britain's Car Industry May Inspire More Balanced Economic Recovery
